  • Method Details

    • getPrecision

      public Integer getPrecision(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Description copied from interface: IDecimalConstraintsHandler
      Gets the precision of values for this datatype. The precision is defined as the number of decimal digits required to represent this value in non-scientific notation. This number includes the IDecimalConstraintsHandler.getScale(Object, gw.lang.reflect.IPropertyInfo) of this datatype. For example, a decimal datatype with a precision of 10 and a scale of 2 can have at most 8 digits to the left of the decimal point (as 2 are reserved for the fractional part).
      Parameters:
      ctx - the object that owns the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
      property - the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.

    • getScale

      @Nullable public Integer getScale(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Description copied from interface: IDecimalConstraintsHandler
      Gets the scale of values for this datatype. The scale is defined as the number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point for values of this datatype.
      Parameters:
      ctx - the object that owns the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
      property - the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.

    • getRange

      public Range<BigDecimal> getRange(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Description copied from interface: IDecimalConstraintsHandler
      Gets the valid value range for this datatype.
      Parameters:
      ctx - the object that owns the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
      property - the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
      Returns:
      the maximum value, or null if this datatype has no maximum.
